content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem and not too easy! Had fun working on the problem!

Is there a specific reason you did not include a case that mixes up the 0 and non-0?
For example '0c 1p' which should lead to p if I am not mistaken?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: easy to undertand description and can be solved very quicly.

Goal
* Please revise as follows:

You'll be given a string which contains space-separated substrings. Each substring consists of an integer followed by a character at the end. You must output a new string by repeating each character the number of times specified by its preceding integer. The output should not contain any space characters.

If the resultant new string is empty, output {{NONE}}.

Input
* Please rewrite as follows:
<<Line 1>>: A string [[Str]] which contains space-separated substrings.

Output
* Please rewrite as follows:
<<Line 1>>: A string resulted from the conversion of [[Str]] as described in the statement, or {{NONE}} if the resultant string is empty.

Constraints
* Please change "num before chars" to "integer before the character in each substring in [[Str]]".

* Please add "The last character of each substring may be a letter, a digit or a special character, but never a space."

Cases
* Please add a pair of cases where all the last characters of the substrings are either special characters or uppercase letters, and all the integers are double-digit integers.

Thanks.

The insightful feedback you provided is very pertinent. Your advice really helped me see where I could improve the subject more effectively.
Thank you for your comment, I appreciate it !
Yes, I agree, I just forgot that case, thank you.

Thank you too!

Certain matters not yet followed up:

Goal
* Please add:
If the resultant new string is empty, output {{NONE}}.

Input
* Please delete "Note", and move the rest of the note to Constraints section.

Constraints
* Please delete the quotation marks.

Cases
* Please ADD (do not modify any existing cases) a pair of cases where all the last characters of the subtrings are uppercase letters.

Thanks.
